poem:
**A Vision in Motion**

In a world of circuits and wheels,  
George rode his dream—  
a chain-link whisper,  
a code's embrace;  
his mind spinning with innovation's grace.  
  
At each pulse of pedal,  
at every keystroke's hum,  
visions of progress sped—  
a gleam on silicon streets—  
where memory meets the human heart.

He then moved in 1971 to Queen Mary and Westfield College (now Queen Mary, University of London), progressing from lecturer to reader to professor in the department". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
